generif.text: May be involved in proliferation and/or differentiation of leukemic cells.
Overexpression of Staf50 inhibited the HIV-1 infection between 50% and 90% in 293 T CD4/CCR5 as well as in monocyte-derived macrophages.
These data suggest a more complex role for TRIM22 during T lymphocyte activation than merely as an antiproliferative factor.
TRIM22 inhibits HIV-1 particle production by interfering with the trafficking of Gag to the plasma membrane and is a key player in the antiviral activity of the Type I interferon response to HIV-1.
A novel property of TRIM22, E3 ubiquitin ligase activity, was demonstrated.
Study shows that human and rhesus TRIM22 localise to different subcellular compartments and that this difference can be assigned to the positively selected B30.2 domain.
TRIM22 is an E3 Ubiquitin ligase whose expression leads to antiviral effects towards Encephalomyocarditis virus infections in HeLa cells. [TRIM22]

Deletion of putative nuclear localization signal abolished TRIM22 localization and nuclear body (NB) formation, the B30.2/SplA and ryanodine receptor (SPRY) domain, and residues 491-494 specifically are essential for nuclear localization and NB formation.
TRIM22-mediated anti-hepatitis B virus activity dependent on the nuclear-located RING domain
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
REVIEW: current knowledge on the anti-retroviral effects of TRIM5 alpha and TRIM22
Specific polymorphisms in tripartite motif22 (TRIM22) genes were significantly associated with rubella vaccine humoral immunity
endogenous TRIM22 is localized to both nucleus and cytosol in primary human mononuclear cells, as well as in the human osteosarcoma cell line U2OS
These data suggest concordance between type 1 IFN and TRIM22 in PBMCs and that TRIM22 likely acts as an antiviral effector in HIV-1 infection.
Nuclear TRIM22 significantly impairs HIV-1 replication, likely by interfering with Tat- and NF-kappaB-independent long-terminal-repeat-driven transcription.
These data suggested that TRIM22 was a positive regulator of NF-kappaB-mediated transcription.
BRG1-mediated chromatin remodeling is critical for the IFN-gamma-inducibility of TRIM22 gene.

TRIM22 to repress protein translation preferably of some specific mRNAs. TRIM22 represses translation by inhibiting the binding of eIF4E to eIF4G, suggesting a mechanism for regulation of protein translation

Restriction of influenza A virus replication was accounted for by the interaction between TRIM22 and the viral nucleoprotein (NP), resulting in its polyubiquitination and degradation in a proteasome-dependent manner

p300 contributed to both IFN-gamma- and IRF-1-mediated TRIM22 transcription independent of its histone acetyltransferase activity, however, it was required for the recruitment of RNA polymerase II to TRIM22 promoter region.
These data indicate that overexpression of TRIM22 may negatively regulate the TRAF6-stimulated NF-kappaB pathway by interacting with and degrading TAB2.
TRIM22 genetic diversity affects HIV-1 replication in vitro and it is a potentially novel determinant of HIV-1 disease severity
Data report that markers in two TRIMs, TRIM5 and TRIM22 and a marker in BST2, associated statistically with the risk of getting MS.
this study shows that TRIM22 is greatly under-expressed in breast cancer. p53 dysfunction may be one of the mechanisms for TRIM22 down-regulation.
TRIM5alpha and TRIM22 have differential transcriptional regulation and distinct anti-HIV roles according to infection phase.
our data characterize the extensive genetic variation in TRIM22 and identify rs1063303:G>C as a highly prevalent SNP that influences its function.
Upregulation of TRIM22 may be associated with responsiveness to Peg-IFNalpha-2a/RBV combination therapy in hepatitis C.
A number of putative structural and functional residues, including several sites that undergo post-translational modification, were also identified in TRIM22.

TRIM22 could interact with IkappaB kinase (IKK)alpha but not IKKbeta and could increase the level and phosphorylation of IKKalpha through its really interesting new gene (RING) and spla-ryanodine receptor (SPRY) domains.
Interferon-alpha-induced TRIM22 interrupts hepatitis c virus replication by ubiquitinating NS5A.
regulation of FoxO4 protein expression and cell survival by TRIM22 controls TLR3-mediated IFN type I gene induction, preventing excessive antiviral response through dsRNA-induced apoptosis.
Data show that capsid protein p24-DsRed-Monomer was co-localized with tripartite motif containing 22 (TRIM22)-EGFP in HEK293T cells.
propose that TRIM22 is a direct target gene of PR and that it can mediate progesterone actions in uterine cells
Demonstrated that TRIM22 acts as a negative regulator of HIV-1 replication via inhibition of basal Sp1-driven proviral transcription.
Infant with severe IBD characterized by granulomatous colitis and severe perianal disease, we identified a homozygous variant of TRIM22 that affects the ability of its product to regulate NOD2.

TRIM5 and TRIM22 single nucleotide polymorphisms are associated to increased odds of significant liver fibrosis and sustained virological response after pegIFNalpha/RBV therapy in human immunodeficiency virus/hepatitis C virus coinfected patients.

Wthis study identified a genetic variation (rs7935564 G allele) in TRIM22 gene, which encodes TRIM22 protein acting like a HIV restriction factor, as being associated with good response to dendritic cell-based immunotherapy

Upregulation of TRIM22 triggers the expression and oligomerization of Bak and subsequently leads to cytochrome c release in a caspase-9- and caspase-3-dependent manner. Both the RING domain and the SPRY domain of the TRIM22 molecule are associated with its pro-apoptotic function.
Suppression of interferon-mediated anti-HBV response by single CpG methylation in the 5'-UTR of TRIM22.
trim22 is a broad and multifunctional host anti-viral factor induced by interferons.
TRIM22 may act as epigenetic inhibitor of HIV-1 transcription by preventing the binding of the host cell transcription factor Sp1 to the viral promoter.
miR-215 facilitated HCV replication via inactivation of the NF-kappaB pathway by inhibiting TRIM22, providing a novel potential target for HCV infection.
Loss of TRIM22 suppresses the progression and invasion of CML through regulation of PI3K/Akt/mTOR pathway.
Results suggest that TRIM22-augmented autophagy prevents intracellular Mtb to evade autophagic clearance, thereby inhibiting the persistence of Mtb infections.
TRIM22 is a novel determinant of HIV-1 latency, at least in T cell lines.
Downregulation of TRIM22 in patients who failed to attain rapid virus clearance.
TRIM22 inhibits endometrial cancer progression through the NOD2/NFkappaB signaling pathway and confers a favorable prognosis.
TRIM22 inhibits respiratory syncytial virus replication by targeting JAK-STAT1/2 signaling.
Long Noncoding RNA LINC01207 Promotes Colon Cancer Cell Proliferation and Invasion by Regulating miR-3125/TRIM22 Axis.
Knockdown of Tripartite motif-containing 22 (TRIM22)relieved the apoptosis of lens epithelial cells by suppressing the expression of TNF receptor-associated factor 6 (TRAF6).
Constitutive TRIM22 Expression in the Respiratory Tract Confers a Pre-Existing Defence Against Influenza A Virus Infection.
TRIM22 genotype is not associated with markers of disease progression in children with HIV-1 infection.
TRIM22 inhibits osteosarcoma progression through destabilizing NRF2 and thus activation of ROS/AMPK/mTOR/autophagy signaling.
Role of TRIM22 in ulcerative colitis and its underlying mechanisms.
FOXC1mediated TRIM22 regulates the excessive proliferation and inflammation of fibroblastlike synoviocytes in rheumatoid arthritis via NFkappaB signaling pathway.
On the relationship between tripartite motif-containing 22 single-nucleotide polymorphisms and COVID-19 infection severity.
TRIM22 actives PI3K/Akt/mTOR pathway to promote psoriasis through enhancing cell proliferation and inflammation and inhibiting autophagy.
TRIM22 promotes the proliferation of glioblastoma cells by activating MAPK signaling and accelerating the degradation of Raf-1.
TRIM22 induces cellular senescence by targeting PHLPP2 in hepatocellular carcinoma.
The E3 ligase TRIM22 restricts SARS-CoV-2 replication by promoting proteasomal degradation of NSP8.

name: tripartite motif containing 22
summary: The protein encoded by this gene is a member of the tripartite motif (TRIM) family. The TRIM motif includes three zinc-binding domains, a RING, a B-box type 1 and a B-box type 2, and a coiled-coil region. This protein localizes to the cytoplasm and its expression is induced by interferon. The protein is involved in innate immunity against different DNA and RNA viruses. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2021].
